summary: This document is a forwarded email chain containing a press release from Prince Andrew's legal team (Blackfords LLP) responding to public statements by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman. The release asserts Prince Andrew has offered cooperation as a witness three times in 2020, disputes Berman's claims of 'zero cooperation,' and criticizes the DOJ for breaching confidentiality rules. It includes internal email forwarding between DOJ officials and a journalist.

events.description: The DOJ first requested Prince Andrew's help in their investigation into Epstein and other targets.

events.title: Berman's First Public Statement
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman made a public statement leading to worldwide media reports of a 'wall of silence' and 'zero cooperation' from Prince Andrew.

events.title: Berman's Second Public Statement
events.description: Berman made further public statements saying Prince Andrew had 'completely shut the door' on cooperation and the DOJ was 'considering' further options.

events.title: Press Release Issued
events.description: Prince Andrew's legal team issues a press release clarifying his offers of cooperation and criticizing the DOJ for breaching confidentiality.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew's legal team states he has offered to cooperate as a witness to the DOJ on at least three occasions in 2020.
The DOJ advised Prince Andrew's team that he is not and has never been a 'target' of their criminal investigations into Jeffrey Epstein.
The press release accuses U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and the DOJ of breaching confidentiality rules by making public statements claiming 'zero cooperation' from Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew's legal working group includes law firm Blackfords LLP, barristers Clare Montgomery QC and Stephen Ferguson, and media relations firm Riverside Advisory.
The document reveals tension between Prince Andrew's team and the SDNY over the public characterization of his cooperation, with his team suggesting the DOJ is seeking publicity.
